title: The tensorflow code that warps points with a given flow
body:
Hi @adalca,Thanks for your wonderful work and  code! It help me a lot.
I want to calculate the TRE of the landmarks of two images and I am using the code you provided.
```
def point_spatial_transformer(surface_points, trf, single=False):
    """
    surface_points is a N x D or a N x (D+1) Tensor
    trf is a *volshape x D Tensor
    """

    surface_pts_D = surface_points.get_shape().as_list()[-1]
    trf_D = trf.get_shape().as_list()[-1]
    assert surface_pts_D in [trf_D, trf_D + 1]

    if surface_pts_D == trf_D + 1:
        li_surface_pts = K.expand_dims(surface_points[..., -1], -1)
        surface_points = surface_points[..., :-1]

    # just need to interpolate.
    # at each location determined by surface point, figure out the trf...
    # Note: if surface_points are on the grid, gather_nd should work as well
    fn = lambda x: nrn_utils.interpn(x[0], x[1])
    diff = tf.map_fn(fn, [trf, surface_points], dtype=tf.float32)
    ret = surface_points + diff

    if surface_pts_D == trf_D + 1:
        ret = tf.concat((ret, li_surface_pts), -1)

    return ret
```
My code is as followsï¼š
```
moving_image_landmarks = np.loadtxt('./landmarksmoving_image_landmarks.txt')
fixed_image_landmarks = np.loadtxt( './landamrks/fixed_image_landmarks.txt')
dvf_Data = nib.load(./dvf/displacement.nii.gz)
...
...
...
moved_image_landmarks = point_spatial_transformer(moving_image_landmarks, dvf_Data).
difference = moved_image_landmarks - fixed_image_landmarks
# Landmarks include 300 points
for i in range(0,300,1):
        sum_difference += np.linalg.norm(difference[i])
# TRE
print(sum_difference/300)
```
I used the code to get a result that is similar to not applying displacement.So I think I might have made some mistakes.Am I doing it right in these places?
